msContents.summary: List of books carried down for Epharmostos: an unknown collection by Kallisthenes and a collection of "Embassies." Perhaps the books came from Zenon

msItem.note: Fragment broken at left and below; 6 lines written along the fibers; the back is blank
The fragment is in bad condition: worm-eaten and incomplete

origin.persName: Kallisthenes, associate of Aristotle and author of a book mentioned in the papyrus

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; no. 86 in Bell

keywords.term: Epharmostos, -- younger brother of Zenon, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 330

div.ab: Books which have been carried down for Epharmostos. Collection of the Pro(xeny?) of Kallisthenes and of the Embassies-------

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. IV 60 P.Col.Zen. II 60 Plate in P.Col. IV opposite p. 6; corrections by Pearson in "Classical Philology" 44 (1949) 200-202. Text and photo in De Luca "Archeologia e papiri" pp. 162-63 with corrections; new edition to appear in "Corpus dei Papiri Storici"
